Sondeju.title: Survey generator
content: Project carried out during my school career.

This is a web application that allows you to **dynamically create**, using a WYSIWYG editor, **polls** and **surveys** and then classify them by category. All these creations are then **publicly accessible** on the home page.
This allows anyone visiting the site to **participate in surveys** that interest them, thus promoting **interaction** and **diversity of responses.**

In addition to participation, the application also offers the possibility of **consulting the results of surveys free of charge**. By making surveys publicly accessible, Sondeju **democratizes access to studies.**
This allows everyone, regardless of their background or geographic location, to contribute to research and share unique perspectives or even re-educate themselves on subjects that question them.

JobScheduler.title: Job scheduler
content: A job scheduler is a system for **automating the sequence of computer tasks**. Unlike a scheduler, which only defines launch dates, a scheduler **conditions the execution of a task**. These conditions can be **temporal** or **resource** (materials or a end of execution token, for example). The scheduler will therefore wait until all the prerequisites of a task are met to execute it and so on to **create a sequence of tasks.**
My solution has a three-component architecture:
- **agent servers**: responsible for **executing jobs and output actions**.
- **rich client**: allows the user to **monitor and manage jobs interactively**.
- **database server**: **stores the data** and **transmits it to the two other components** via a Rest API and Server-sent Events (real time).
Maven - Spring boot - JavaFx - MySQL - Server-sent Events

CRM.title: CRM
content: Project carried out during my first internship.
Creation of a **Customer Relationship Management** tool in Symfony.
- **basic functionalities**: management of client companies and their contacts, classification according to the sources and interests of each company, task management,
- contact card display during an incoming call. This required the use of **Server-sent Events** and setting up a **Mercure Hub** platform,
- creation of a Google Gmail module, with the **Google App Script** language, in order to **display contact information** when viewing an email, but also to **archive the email** in the CRM.
Symfony ecosystem (Twig, Routing, Auth, Workflow, ...) - Server-sent events (Mercure) - Google App Script - ChartJs - Leaflet - CSS
